meanings.definition: To fasten or secure with battens.
meanings.sent1: She battened the door to keep it from swinging in the wind.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter battened down the hatches before the storm.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel battened the nuts in place for safekeeping.
meanings.sent4: The gardener battened the vines to the trellis for support.
meanings.sent5: He battened the loose shingles on the roof to prevent leaks.

meanings.sent1: The cat battened up after being fed a hearty meal.
meanings.sent2: The bear battened on fish before hibernating for the winter.
meanings.sent3: The pig battened happily on the leftover scraps.
meanings.sent4: The cow battened on fresh grass in the lush pasture.
meanings.sent5: The squirrel battened on acorns to prepare for winter.

meanings.sent1: The small business battened in the bustling market.
meanings.sent2: The crops battened under the care of the skilled farmer.
meanings.sent3: The town battened with the opening of a new factory.
meanings.sent4: The community battened with the arrival of new residents.
meanings.sent5: The company battened after implementing innovative strategies.
